name: Athens
description: Primary grain import destination. High crop failure risk (28%) due to Attic soil limitations and weather variability.

name: Alexandria
description: Major grain export hub. Zenon Papyri price: 2.5 drachmas per medimnos. Weather-dependent Nile flood affects supply.

name: Nile Delta
description: Fertile grain-producing region. Zenon Papyri price: 2.2 drachmas per medimnos. Nile flood variability critical for yields.

name: Fayum
description: Agricultural center. Zenon Papyri price: 2.0 drachmas per medimnos. Lake Moeris irrigation dependent on Nile floods.

name: Chersonesos
description: Black Sea grain source. Weather patterns affect shipping through the Hellespont and Bosporus.

name: Byzantium
description: Critical transit point for Black Sea grain. Weather conditions in the Bosporus affect shipping.

name: Syracuse
description: Sicilian grain source. Mediterranean weather patterns and volcanic activity affect production and shipping.

name: Cyrene
description: North African grain source. Arid climate makes production sensitive to rainfall patterns.

name: Tyre
description: Phoenician trading port. Weather affects grain transit from Egypt and local production.

name: Sidon
description: Phoenician trading port. Coastal weather patterns influence grain shipping routes.

name: Rhodes
description: Important maritime hub. Etesian winds affect grain shipping routes through the Aegean.

name: Crete
description: Island transit point. Weather patterns in the southern Aegean affect grain shipping.

name: Delos
description: Sacred island and trading center. Etesian winds critical for grain shipping timing.

name: Aegina
description: Near Athens, important for grain distribution. Local weather affects final leg of grain transport.

name: Aspendos
description: Pamphylian port. Weather patterns affect grain transit from eastern sources.
